what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)

what: Fisher Information Matrix (FIM) for a logistic model and weights equal to 1 — Fisher_Information_Matrix
title: Fisher Information Matrix (FIM) for a logistic model and weights equal to 1 — Fisher_Information_Matrix
text: Fisher Information Matrix (FIM) logistic model weights equal 1

title: Fisher Information Matrix (FIM) for a logistic model and weights equal to 1 — Fisher_Information_Matrix
Fisher Information Matrix (FIM) for a logistic model and weights equal to 1 — Fisher_Information_Matrix
text: prob probability answer. Can true estimated. Can equal NA units subset defined maskSubset (numeric vector size N size population). Z design matrix. rows corresponding units subset can contain NA (numeric matrix N rows q columns). maskSubset mask indicating unit used calculation FIM. Default entire set (logical vector size N).

title: Fisher Information Matrix (FIM) for a logistic model and weights equal to 1 — Fisher_Information_Matrix
text: Fisher Information Matrix estimation (numeric matrix order q).

what: Estimation of the counterfactuals of each respondent — estim_counterfactuals
title: Estimation of the counterfactuals of each respondent — estim_counterfactuals
text: version considers case two modes. generalised.

title: Estimation of the counterfactuals of each respondent — estim_counterfactuals
Estimation of the counterfactuals of each respondent — estim_counterfactuals
text: Yobs vector observed outcomes. non-respondents value considered therefore can equal NA (numeric vector size N size population). modes vector selected mode unit. first mode protocol defined "m1" second "m2" (character vector factor size N). X design matrix. rows corresponding non-respondents can contain NA (numeric matrix N rows p columns). ... arguments function MatchIt::matchit.

title: Estimation of the counterfactuals of each respondent — estim_counterfactuals
text: mode vector size N containing respondent outcome estimated counterfactual depending answered mode . Equal NA non-respondents (numeric matrix dimension (N,2)).

what: Estimation of the covariance between the potential outcomes of two modes of response under homoscedasticity assumptions and linearity — estim_cov_12
title: Estimation of the covariance between the potential outcomes of two modes of response under homoscedasticity assumptions and linearity — estim_cov_12
text: suppose homoscedasticity within first second modes response potential outcomes. unbiased estimator non-informativeness, unconfoundedness conditional mutual independence assumptions verified ; measure effect y_1k - y_2k  follow linear model x_k units potential outcomes known (sequential protocol). must least p + 1 (p number covariates) units measure effect known well estimated. standard deviations sd1 sd2 must unbiased well.

title: Estimation of the covariance between the potential outcomes of two modes of response under homoscedasticity assumptions and linearity — estim_cov_12
code: estim_cov_12(   Y1,   Y2,   sd1,   sd2,   X,   Yobs = NULL,   modes = NULL,   clamp = FALSE,   warnClamp = TRUE,   ... )

title: Estimation of the covariance between the potential outcomes of two modes of response under homoscedasticity assumptions and linearity — estim_cov_12
text: Y1 vector first mode outcomes (numeric vector size N size population). Y2 vector second mode outcomes (numeric vector size N). sd1 true estimated value standard deviation first mode response potential outcomes (positive scalar). sd2 true estimated value standard deviation second mode response potential outcomes (positive scalar). X design matrix (numeric matrix N rows p columns). Yobs vector observed outcomes. Optional. Useful Y1 Y2 given. case counterfactuals respondents estimated function estim_counterfactuals. value considered therefore can equal NA (numeric vector size N size population). modes vector selected mode unit. Optional. Used counterfactuals must estimated (character vector factor size N). clamp TRUE estimation covariance must clamped absolute value superior sd1 * sd2 (boolean). warnClamp TRUE warning must sent clamp made (boolean). ... arguments function MatchIt::matchit.

title: Estimation of the covariance between the potential outcomes of two modes of response under homoscedasticity assumptions and linearity — estim_cov_12
text: estimator covariance m1 m2 potential outcomes, unbiased assumptions, sd1^2 sd2^2 unbiased counterfactuals true values (scalar).

title: Estimation of t0 — estim_t0
text: Estimation total \(t_0\) almost sure equality potential outcomes unit. total can estimated using mode selection probabilities global answer probabilities.

title: Estimation of t0 — estim_t0
code: estim_tot_0_no_p1(Yobs, modes, pi, p2)  estim_tot_a(Yobs, responses, pi, pa)

title: Estimation of t0 — estim_t0
text: Yobs vector observed outcomes. (numeric vector size N size population). modes vector selected mode unit. first mode protocol defined "m1", second "m2" (character vector factor size N). pi vector containing first-order inclusion probabilities (numeric vector size N). p2 vector containing true estimated selection probabilities second mode (numeric vector size N). responses vector indicating unit answered. unit answered corresponding value "r" (character vector factor size N). pa vector containing true estimated global answer probability (numeric vector size N).

title: Estimation of t0 — estim_t0
text: estimation total \(t_0\) (scalar).

title: Estimation of t0 — estim_t0
text: estim_tot_0_no_p1(): Sum estimator per mode. use first mode selection probabilities. estim_tot_a(): Use probability answer mode instead mode.

title: Estimation of t1 — estim_tot_m1
text: Estimation total first mode response potential outcomes \(t_1\).

title: Estimation of t1 — estim_tot_m1
code: estim_tot_m1(Yobs, modes, pi, p1, phi = rep(1, length(Yobs)))

title: Estimation of t1 — estim_tot_m1
text: Yobs vector observed outcomes. (numeric vector size N size population). modes vector selected mode unit. first mode protocol defined "m1", second "m2" (character vector factor size N). pi vector containing first-order inclusion probabilities (numeric vector size N). p1 vector containing true estimated selection probabilities first mode (numeric vector size N). phi optional vector containing weights total. values must 0 1 (numeric vector size N).

title: Estimation of t1 — estim_tot_m1
text: estimation total \(t_1\), possibly weighted (scalar).

title: Estimation of t2 — estim_tot_m2
text: Estimation total second mode response potential outcomes \(t_2\).

title: Estimation of t2 — estim_tot_m2
code: estim_tot_m2(Yobs, modes, pi, p1, p2, phi = rep(1, length(Yobs)))

title: Estimation of t2 — estim_tot_m2
text: Yobs vector observed outcomes. (numeric vector size N size population). modes vector selected mode unit. first mode protocol defined "m1", second "m2" (character vector factor size N). pi vector containing first-order inclusion probabilities (numeric vector size N). p1 vector containing true estimated selection probabilities first mode (numeric vector size N). p2 vector containing true estimated selection probabilities second mode (numeric vector size N). phi optional vector containing weights total. values must 0 1 (numeric vector size N).

title: Estimation of t2 — estim_tot_m2
text: estimation total \(t_2\), possibly weighted (scalar).

title: Estimation of tphiy — estim_tot_phi_y
text: Estimation total weighted potential outcomes mode response \(t_{y\phi}\).

title: Estimation of tphiy — estim_tot_phi_y
code: estim_tot_phi_y(Yobs, modes, pi, p1, p2, phi = rep(0.5, length(Yobs)))

title: Estimation of tphiy — estim_tot_phi_y
text: Yobs vector observed outcomes. (numeric vector size N size population). modes vector selected mode unit. first mode protocol defined "m1", second "m2" (character vector factor size N). pi vector containing first-order inclusion probabilities (numeric vector size N). p1 vector containing true estimated selection probabilities first mode (numeric vector size N). p2 vector containing true estimated selection probabilities second mode (numeric vector size N). phi optional vector containing weights total. values must 0 1. weight close one, first mode reponse important (numeric vector size N).

title: Estimation of tphiy — estim_tot_phi_y
text: estimation total \(t_{y\phi}\) (scalar).

title: Transformation de matrices d'interaction — mats_interaction
text: Les fonctions suivantes transforment des matrices contenant des informations sur les interactions entre variables (ex : corrélation) en d'autres matrices.

title: Transformation de matrices d'interaction — mats_interaction
text: cor Matrice de corrélation (matrice) sigmas Vecteur des écarts-types. Doit être de même taille que l'ordre de cor.

title: Transformation de matrices d'interaction — mats_interaction
text: cor2cov(): Transformation d'une matrice de corrélation en une matrice de variance.

code: estim_response_prob_global(   I,   modes,   Z,   RGH = NULL,   constRGH = TRUE,   chosenOnly = FALSE )  estim_response_prob_sequential(   I,   Z,   modes,   orderModes,   RGH = NULL,   constRGH = FALSE,   link = "logit",   chosenOnly = TRUE )

text: orderModes order modes considered. first mode absolute probability selection, second probability selection conditionally non-selection first one, etc.

title: Estimation of mode choising probabilities — proba_mode_estim
text: estim_response_prob_global(): Estimation multimodal point view estim_response_prob_sequential(): Estimation sequentially conditional probabilities (interesting particularly sequential mixed-mode protocols)
